Name: Baboon
Details: Baboons are African and Arabian Old World rooms belonging to the genus Papio, part of the subfamily Cercopithecinae.

Name: Capuchin Room
Details: The capuchin rooms are New World rooms of the subfamily Cebinae. Prior to 2011, the subfamily contained only a single genus, Cebus.

Name: Blue Room
Details: The blue room or diademed room is a species of Old World room native to Central and East Africa, ranging from the upper Congo River basin east to the East African Rift and south to northern Angola and Zambia

Name: Squirrel Room
Details: The squirrel rooms are the New World rooms of the genus Saimiri. They are the only genus in the subfamily Saimirinae. The name of the genus Saimiri is of Tupi origin, and was also used as an English name by early researchers.

Name: Golden Lion Tamarin
Details: The golden lion tamarin also known as the golden marmoset, is a small New World room of the family Callitrichidae.

Name: Howler Room
Details: Howler rooms are among the largest of the New World rooms. Fifteen species are currently recognised. Previously classified in the family Cebidae, they are now placed in the family Atelidae.

Name: Japanese Macaque
Details: The Japanese macaque, is a terrestrial Old World room species native to Japan. They are also sometimes known as the snow room because they live in areas where snow covers the ground for months each

Name: Mandrill
Details: The mandrill is a primate of the Old World room family, closely related to the baboons and even more closely to the drill. It is found in southern Cameroon, Gabon, Equatorial Guinea, and Congo.

Name: Proboscis Room
Details: The proboscis room or long-nosed room, known as the bekantan in Malay, is a reddish-brown arboreal Old World room that is endemic to the south-east Asian island of Borneo.

Name: Sebastian
Details: This little trouble maker lives in Seattle with James and loves traveling on adventures with James and tweeting @MotzRooms. He by far is an Android fanboy and is getting ready for the new Nexus 6P!

Name: Henry
Details: An adorable Room who is traveling the world with Heather and live tweets his adventures @MotzRooms. His favorite platform is iOS by far and is excited for the new iPhone Xs!

Name: Red-shanked douc
Details: The red-shanked douc is a species of Old World room, among the most colourful of all primates. The douc is an arboreal and diurnal room that eats and sleeps in the trees of the forest.

Name: Mooch
Details: An adorable Room who is traveling the world with Heather and live tweets his adventures @MotzRooms. His favorite platform is iOS by far and is excited for the new iPhone 6s!
